The program emphasizes environmental impact assessment, refrigerant-based cooling cycles analysis, and natural refrigerants understanding for comprehensive sustainable cooling technologies development.

! Nr. 6_A.Zajacs_WP5_MS16.course_title: 6 Energy: Smart district scale management of energy systems
! Nr. 6_A.Zajacs_WP5_MS16.description: The study course introduces the structure of the heat and power system and electrical networks. Topics such as energy needs, energy demand profiles, and transmission and distribution networks will be covered. An overview of the energy districts on different scales will be provided, and the main principles of the energy market will be explained. The practical classes of the study course focus on the methods of problem-solving and their application using computer software. The content of the study course comprises thermal and electrical systems and network management, development and planning tasks and their most typical problem solutions. Within the study course, various aspects (criteria) are considered - technical, economic, quality, security of energy supply, market, ecological, social, information uncertainties and others.
! Nr. 6_A.Zajacs_WP5_MS16.enhanced_description: Technology for smart energy district management and district-scale energy system optimization - this course delivers comprehensive expertise in energy system planning and electricity demand analysis using advanced heat demand assessment and energy resource evaluation methodologies. Students will master renewable energy integration strategies, sector coupling approaches, and transmission networks design for optimal distribution networks performance and smart grid technologies implementation. The curriculum focuses on practical energy market fundamentals understanding, energy infrastructure design principles, and energy flexibility management techniques for smart energy district applications. Participants will gain hands-on experience with energy economic analysis tools including net present value (NPV), internal rate of return (IRR), and key performance indicators (KPI) evaluation. The program emphasizes positive energy districts development, energy system modeling techniques, and energy scenario planning for comprehensive stakeholder engagement and energy sustainability assessment in modern energy systems.

Nr. 8_IA_JZ_LJ_WP5_MS15.course_title: ECONOMICS AND HOUSING POLICIES FOR DECARBONISATION AND ENERGY MANAGEMENT
Nr. 8_IA_JZ_LJ_WP5_MS15.description: The key aspects of reaching the aim are centred around the energy efficiency of buildings, different variations of green and sustainable construction, building energy management and energy communities, financial incentives and stimulus for the improvement of the energy performance of buildings, the integration and use of different renewable energy sources in buildings, as well as the application of the circularity principle to the use and maintenance of buildings. The course allows students to explore different aspects of the decarbonization of energy and the building sector, as well as national economies, by providing structured, well-rounded and professionally sound information about the role of the built environment, cities and single buildings in the European decarbonization process. The course is based on a blend of socio-economic, engineering and economic aspects of decarbonization of the built environment, which demonstrates an interdisciplinary outlook on processes creating, directing and influencing technologically sufficient and socio-economically justifies decarbonization pathways of existing European building stock.
Nr. 8_IA_JZ_LJ_WP5_MS15.enhanced_description: Technology for building decarbonization and energy management policy implementation - this course delivers comprehensive expertise in housing policy economics and building decarbonization strategies using advanced energy efficiency management and sustainable construction techniques. Students will master green building incentives design, energy cooperatives development, and community energy initiatives implementation for optimal renewable energy integration and solar energy systems deployment. The curriculum focuses on practical heat pump technology applications, energy demand management strategies, and life cycle assessment (LCA) methodologies for circular economy principles integration. Participants will gain hands-on experience with passive energy buildings design, zero energy buildings development, and plus energy buildings construction using green hydrogen infrastructure and building energy monitoring systems. The program emphasizes renovation strategies optimization, healthy housing principles implementation, and energy policy frameworks development for comprehensive green gas technologies, micro-cogeneration systems, and green roofs and facades integration in sustainable building environments.

Nr. 9_P.Anderberg_WP5_MS14.course_title: Sustainable urban transformation and climate change. Decarbonisation and well-being. Key trends of Green Deal. EK Directives, regulations and standardisation related to building decarbonisation. (Nr. 9, WP 5, MS 16)
Nr. 9_P.Anderberg_WP5_MS14.description: This course explores sustainable urban development, covering essential principles, barriers, and opportunities for transforming cities toward sustainability. Students will examine the EU Green Deal, financing for urban decarbonization, energy-efficient building design, and renewable energy integration. Case studies on green technologies, standards, and future trends in urban planning provide practical insights into the sustainable cities of tomorrow.
Nr. 9_P.Anderberg_WP5_MS14.enhanced_description: Technology for sustainable urban transformation and urban decarbonization planning - this course delivers comprehensive expertise in EU Green Deal implementation and urban energy management using advanced energy-efficient buildings design and sustainable construction methodologies. Students will master green building standards development, urban well-being strategies implementation, and green technology innovations for optimal urban sustainability case studies and EU energy directives compliance. The curriculum focuses on practical sustainable construction standards establishment, urban renewable energy integration, and geothermal energy systems deployment for comprehensive solar energy integration and biomethane technology applications. Participants will gain hands-on experience with hydrogen energy systems development, wastewater energy recovery techniques, and urban climate resilience planning for sustainable urban transformation and energy justice frameworks implementation. The program emphasizes interdisciplinary approaches to urban development, renewable energy source optimization, and climate action strategies for creating sustainable cities of tomorrow.

Nr. 11_Jesinska&Dzelzitis_WP5_MS14.course_title: Energy citizenship, inequalities and socio technical transitions
Nr. 11_Jesinska&Dzelzitis_WP5_MS14.description: This course delves into the multifaceted relationship between energy systems and society. It begins by tracing the historical context and evolution of energy citizenship, setting the stage for a critical examination of socio-technical transitions and the transformative role of technology in societal change. Participants will explore the complexities of energy systems and their interactions with social structures, focusing on the pressing issue of social inequalities in energy access. Through an analysis of energy poverty and its impacts, students will gain insight into the ethical implications of energy policies and the concept of energy justice. The course emphasizes the importance of citizen engagement, highlighting effective methods and showcasing successful case studies of participation in energy decision-making. Participants will investigate energy communities within the framework of EU directives and learn about policy frameworks that support energy citizenship.
Nr. 11_Jesinska&Dzelzitis_WP5_MS14.enhanced_description: Technology for energy citizenship development and socio-technical transitions implementation - this course delivers comprehensive expertise in energy citizenship concepts and socio-technical transitions frameworks using advanced energy system analysis and energy inequality assessment methodologies. Students will master energy poverty analysis techniques, energy justice principles application, and energy policy ethics evaluation for optimal citizen engagement strategies and energy community development. The curriculum focuses on practical EU energy directives compliance, digital citizen participation tools utilization, and decentralized energy systems design for comprehensive smart grid technologies integration and energy cooperative formation. Participants will gain hands-on experience with behavioral change theories application, energy behavioral economics implementation, and renewable energy adoption strategies for energy democracy promotion. The program emphasizes interdisciplinary approaches to energy system transformation, social structure integration, and technology-driven societal change for creating equitable and just energy futures.

Nr. 12_L.Vitola&R.Janeliukstis_WP5_MS16.course_title: Determination of the technical condition of a typical residential building and forecast of the period of use. Digital 3D assessment of constructions geometrical, mechanical and physical properties, sensors, laboratory research
Nr. 12_L.Vitola&R.Janeliukstis_WP5_MS16.description: This course offers an in-depth exploration of building condition assessment with a focus on residential structures. Students will gain foundational knowledge in structural analysis, construction materials, and the durability and lifespan of building components. The course covers both traditional and modern assessment techniques, including non-destructive testing (NDT), digital 3D modeling, and Building Information Modeling (BIM). Nr. 14_A.Kundzina_WP5_MS15.course_title: INVESTMENT FOR HOUSING DECARBONISATION AND ENERGY MANAGEMENT. FINANCIAL DIGITAL TOOLS FOR ANALYSIS AND DECISION MAKING ON AFFORDABLE HOUSING
Nr. 14_A.Kundzina_WP5_MS15.description: The European Green Deal is the EU's growth and recovery strategy that aims to transform Europe into the first climate-neutral bloc by 2050. Energy efficiency is a key area of action, without which the full decarbonisation of the EU economy cannot be achieved. Within this context, energy efficiency investments need to be increased in all sectors of the economy. This is the most cost-effective and sustainable way towards climate neutrality. The decarbonisation of the housing stock will make it safer, more affordable and accessible. The study course provides knowledge about the housing decarbonisation and energy management, its basics, different aspects, energy efficiency measures, benefits, problems and improvement possibilities in the building sector, the role of local authorities in energy efficiency issues, as well as financial instruments to support energy efficient projects.

The curriculum focuses on practical residential energy standards development, non-residential energy standards establishment, and energy efficiency cost-benefit analysis for comprehensive technical solution development and building renovation management. Participants will gain hands-on experience with decarbonization education programs, energy policy development, and housing management competencies for effective financial decision-making tools and affordable housing investment strategies. The program emphasizes interdisciplinary approaches to energy efficiency in housing management, covering technical, political, social, and environmental aspects for comprehensive housing sector decarbonization.
